item.title: Derivation of Black-Scholes Model
item.description: Model 1 At time point $t$, let’s say the price of $S_{t}$ units of the underlying asset $1$, and assume that $S_{t}$ undergoes Geometric Brownian Motion. That is, for Standard Brownian Motion $W_{t}$, drift $\mu \in \mathbb{R}$, and diffusion $\sigma^{2} > 0$, $S_{t}$ is the solution to the following Stochastic Differential Equation. $$ d S_{t} = S_{t} \left( \mu dt + \sigma d W_{t} \right) $$ When a risk-free rate
